alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 11:07AM EDT until April 20 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Hazleton and Petersburg. .Rainfall amounts last Wednesday of one to two inches across much of central Indiana...has left lowland and minor flooding along lower portions of the White River. Flooding is expected to end near Petersburg and Hazleton by mid week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins to flood several Pike County roads. Many of the following county roads begin to flood around this level...east of SR 57 include CR 750N...CR 600N and CR 1000E. Pike county road subject to flooding west of SR 57 include...CR 250 W...CR 400W...CR 675N...CR 700 N...CR 1000w...CR 900W...CR 700W and CR 775W. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Monday /9:30 AM CDT Monday/ the stage was 17.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EDT Monday /9:30 AM CDT Monday/ was 18.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Wednesday morning and continue falling to 6.2 feet Thursday, April 28. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
